intro: Iris bungei var. sochondinensis, commonly known as the Sochondin iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features upright, grass-like leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive white stripe on the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
